category: Articles of Incorporation/Article 34 (Representation of Non-Executive Directors)
contents: Article 34 (Representation of Non-Executive Directors) ① If there is an unavoidable reason why a non-executive director cannot attend the board of directors meeting, a representative may be appointed from among the executives and employees of the director recommendation organization or the affiliated public officials and delegate voting rights. In this case, the agent must submit a document certifying the authority of representation to the board of directors. Revised May 26, 2015, ② The document in the latter part of Paragraph 1 must state the reason for delegation, the representative's affiliation, name, and scope of voting rights, and must be signed or affixed by the non-executive director who appointed the representative.
